title: CTRL-labs, makers of an armband that picks up brain signals to control devices, raises $28M from Lux Capital, GV, Vulcan Capital, Founders Fund, and Alexa Fund (Kurt Schlosser/GeekWire)
content: Kurt Schlosser / GeekWire: CTRL-labs, makers of an armband that picks up brain signals to control devices, raises $28M from Lux Capital, GV, Vulcan Capital, Founders Fund, and Alexa Fund  —  Paul Allen's Vulcan Capital is among those raising an interested hand over a 3-year-old startup called CTRL-Labs … More: Next Reality, New York Business Journal, and PE Hub Blog Tweets: @vulcaninc and @mgsiegler More: Tommy Palladino / Next Reality:   Google, Amazon, & More Invest $28M in Nerve-Tapping Technology from CTRL-Labs Anthony Noto / New York Business Journal:   Machine-learning shop CTRL-labs banks $28 million in venture capital Iris Dorbian / PE Hub Blog:   CTRL-labs fetches $28 mln Series A Tweets: @vulcaninc:   Instead of typing commands, this start-up wants reinvent the way we interact with our computers. Meet @CTRLlabsCo, the latest investment from Vulcan Capital. http://vlcn.fyi/... #VulcanCapital pic.twitter.com/RI8CQlqx3J M.G. Siegler / @mgsiegler:   One of the most mind-blowing, and certainly the most mind-controlling demo I've ever seen Thrilled @GVteam is partnering with @CTRLlabsCo http://www.nytimes.com/...
contentWithMarkup:
Kurt Schlosser / GeekWire:
CTRL-labs, makers of an armband that picks up brain signals to control devices, raises $28M from Lux Capital, GV, Vulcan Capital, Founders Fund, and Alexa Fund  —  Paul Allen's Vulcan Capital is among those raising an interested hand over a 3-year-old startup called CTRL-Labs …
